encodingDesc.p: √'d JW 17FE09 agt WILH; ed. JW 16JL10, 27AU15; ed. SK 28MY16; ed. JW 20AP17; ed. JW 27JL17

lg.l: The Verses you sent on the bottling your Wine
Were in evry ones Iudgmt exceedingly fine
And I must confess as a Dean and Divine
I think you inspird by the Muses all nine
\del·Ye·add·J\ nicely examind them every Line
And the worst of them all like a barn door did shine
Oh that Iove would give me such a talent as thine
With Delany or Dan J would scorn to combine
I know they have many a wicked Design
\del·And give Satan is due\ Dan begins to refine
However I wish, honest Comrade of mine
You would really on Thursday leave St Catharine
where I hear you are crammd every day like a Swine
\del·But the loss\ of your Cough will be the best Sign
\in ·margin·stet·del·With me you\'ll no more have a Stomach to Dine
Nor after your Vittels ly Sleeping Supine
So \del·I wish you were toothless\ like Lord Masserine
\del·But were you as\ wicked as lewd Aretine
I wish you would tell me which way you in·cline
If when you return, your \add·alternative·Road·above·way\ you dont line
On Thursday I'll pay my Respects at your Shrine
Wherever you bend, wherever you twine
In Square or in Opposite Circle or Trine
Your Bief will on Thursday be salter than brine
I hope you have Swilld with new milk from the Kine
\del·As much as the Liffee\'s outdone by the Rhine
And Dan shall be with us with Nose aquiline
If you do not come back we shall weep out our eyn
\del·Or may your Gown\ nevr be good Lutherine
The Bief you have got, which I hear is a Chine
But if too many come your Madam will whine
But enough of this Poetry Alexandrine
And then you may kiss the low end of her spine
I hope you will not think this a Pasquine
